revised_title: Inoculation of Horned Cattle to Prevent Contagious Distemper
tldr: The author discusses the usefulness of inoculation in preventing the contagious distemper among horned cattle. He presents evidence that cattle that have recovered from the disease are immune to a second infection, making inoculation a valuable tool in protecting herds. The author also shares accounts of successful inoculation trials, further supporting the practice's effectiveness.
